items.details: MAP TESTING Great job finishing your first MAP test in Science! The next test will be Reading on Wednesday. The best way to get ready is to practice reading every day. Here are some ideas: 1) Read a mix of stories and informational texts 2) Ask yourself questions as you read, like “What happened first?” or “What is the main idea?” 3) Look for new words and try to figure out their meaning from the sentence 4) Retell the story or explain what you learned in your own words 5) Read out loud to practice fluency 6) Practice finding details that support the main idea The MAP test is just a chance to show what you know, so relax, keep reading a little each day, and do your best! Upcoming Class Tests! Tuesday, September 23rd - Language Arts - Grammar Workshop Unit 1 L1-8 Wednesday, September 24th - Math - Topic 3 Monday, September 29th - Social Studies - Topic 1 Reading Complete this week's definitions paper (DUE WEDNESDAY) The story next week is 'Living in Deserts'. Please watch the video until you understand the story. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NxDlziHeNdg The spelling words for next week are from Vocabulary Workshop Units 3 and 4. active bargain gasp loyal resource sensitive struggle value vary wander capture coward exclaim gloomy insist passage restless shallow shatter talent I have assigned a story on What Lives in the Deserts? (DUE FRIDAY) Please complete BEFORE NEXT FRIDAY! Please answer every question and SUBMIT. Go to www.readworks.org/student Enter our class code YU6GQ2 Your password is 1234 unless you already changed it Math Complete the red assessment pages! (DUE TOMORROW). Remember these pages are similar to the test we will take on Wednesday. Please have your child practice a little Khan Academy math each night at https://www.khanacademy.org/join/VK6QDS9E to help strengthen their skills. THIS WILL HELP YOU WITH YOUR MATH MAP TEST Korean Pages 115-119 and 20-33 in the Korean textbook and activity book. Chinese You need to write the words' student/boy/girl' twice before the next class. Language Arts Tomorrow is the grammar workshop test. Please read over Unit 1, Lessons 1-8. (Pages 8-41) This link will help your child prepare for the Grammar Workshop test: https://www.sadlierconnect.com/anonymous/product/gw?productId=494&programId=10&subjectId=1&gradeId=6&programTOCId=-1&programSeriesId=3&hash=dW5kZWZpbmVk On this page, there are extra practice resources and quizzes your child can use for review. Sometimes the page takes a little longer to load, but it should work. Please note that it may not open properly on some phones or tablets, so using a computer is best. Social Studies Group Project Your groups are: Land and Water - Stella / Jenny / Jiwoo Weather, Climate and Forces of Nature - Siwoo / Ian Choi / Jason Using Earth’s Resources - Jey / Noah / Alex Interacting with the Environment - Woojoo / Yujoo / Ian Sa Each group has three students. You need to read your chapter in the book and summarize the important information. Then you will reteach your lesson to the class. You must do three things. A Google Slides or PowerPoint presentation that is bright and clear. An A3 poster that is colorful and eye-catching. A quiz that is fun and gets the class involved. The quiz could be an X and O quiz, a fill-in-the-gap quiz, or something online. Each person in the group should take one job. One person makes the slides. One person makes the poster. One person makes the quiz. Your goal is to make your classmates learn from you in a fun and creative way. You will present this on Wednesday, September 24th, the lesson before the social studies test. ReadWorks Assignment 5/6 – Tropical Rainforests / Natural Resources (8 stories) I have assigned a story on Rainforest and 8 stories about natural disasters on ReadWorks. Please complete it within the next 2 weeks. Go to www.readworks.org/student Enter our class code YU6GQ2 Your password is 1234 unless you already changed it
